description: Variation of planning condition 6 (use class restriction) and 7 (hours of operation) of planning permission ref: P/2001/4078 dated 05/09/2003, demolition of existing buildings, erection of a four storey apartment block of 18 flats and a ground floor health centre fronting Broadway and a two storey block of four flats fronting York Avenue with parking to allow use of the ground floor as a creche (D1 use) and to extend the permitted hours of operation from 08:00 - 19:00 (Monday to Friday) and 08:00 to 13:00 on Saturday and not at any time on Sundays and Bank Holidays to 07:30 - 19:30 (Monday to Friday) and 08:00 to 13:00 on Saturday and not any time on Sundays and Bank Holidays.
decision_conditions: The commercial floorspace shown on drawing 237/005 A k shall be used for any purpose within Class D1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, except for the provision of education (with the exception of a crFche or day nursery), a place or worship or a public hall, without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.   REASON: To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013); and Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan. | The D1 use shall not operate outside 0730 to 1930 hours Monday to Friday, 0800 to 1300 hours on Saturday and not at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.   REASON: In the interest of the living conditions of adjoining residents in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013); and Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan. | Prior to the occupation of the D1 floorspace as a crFche or day nursery, details of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to be provided within the development and separated from the existing domestic refuse storage facilities, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details before the occupation of the D1 floorspace as a crFche or day nursery.   Reason: In the interests of amenity and the recycling of waste materials in support of the Boroughs waste reduction targets having regard for 3.5 and 5.16 and 7a, 3.5 and 7b of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | Prior to the occupation of the D1 floorspace as a crFche or day nursery, details of a Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details submitted shall be designed to manage the transport needs of crFche staff, pupils, parents and visitors, in order to demonstrate a car restraint policy for the site, minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport. Delivery arrangements shall also be included. The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation thereafter.  Reason: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of the Council's policies on sustainability are met in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.10, 6.11 and 6.13 of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013, policies 1.1(f) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, and the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Document 'Sustainable Transport for New Development'. | In the event that the D1 floorpsace is occupied as a crFche or day nursery then no more than eight professional staff shall operate from the site at any one time and no more than twenty pupils shall attend the site at any one time.   REASON: In the interests of local residents living conditions and the highway network in accordance with policies 7A, 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (July 2011); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012).
